channel.title: Need help with client
channel.description:
I've been having trouble with my client for a bit now. I got the source on the only thing I have left to do is getting on. Info: JRE version: jre7 JDK version: jdk1.7.0_04 Vista x64 PI server So there are 2 runs. Run.bat and Run Cmd.bat Both are doing 2 different things First I'll describe Run Cmd.bat because its the one I'm a little further into. Heres my current Run Cmd.bat
@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ java -Xmx300m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause
The error it gives me is:
Error: Could not find or load main class Launcher Press any key to continue . . .
Now I tried changing it to
@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause
This one gives me the error
Error: Could not find or load main class Gui Press any key to continue . . .
So either way I get an error. I looked through the files and couldn't find a Gui.class or Gui.java file. So any help with this would be great :) Now Run.bat Run.bat simply doesn't start. My current run.bat
@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ start javaw -Xmx500m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 exit
When I change exit to pause to see the error it says press any key to continue. There is nothing else. I have tried changing it to things like
@echo off title Client cd bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javaw.exe" -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @Detriot Detriot
item.description:
@Detriot wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:4, topic:444448”]Try this;

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Make sure all ur class files are in a folder called Class & that ur run.bat is not![/quote]

That gives me a can’t find main class launcher error when put into run.bat and my class files and run.bat are where they should be.

STILL NEED HELP

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Try this;

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx512m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

Make sure all ur class files are in a folder called Class & that ur run.bat is not!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @Detriot Detriot
item.description:
@Detriot wrote:

r0m3r0:

You only need 1 Run.bat well unless you have a jframe but don’t worry about that, you probably have to set your environmental variables. Do you have Jdk?

JDK version: jdk1.7.0_04

So I only need to get run.bat to work? Great because thats not giving me an error and just closes right away

Heres my environmental variables

Lightshot

Screenshot

Captured with Lightshot

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with client
item.dc:creator: @Detriot Detriot
item.description:
@Detriot wrote:

I’ve been having trouble with my client for a bit now. I got the source on the only thing I have left to do is getting on.

Info:

JRE version: jre7
JDK version: jdk1.7.0_04
Vista x64
PI server

So there are 2 runs. Run.bat and Run Cmd.bat

Both are doing 2 different things

First I’ll describe Run Cmd.bat because its the one I’m a little further into.
Heres my current Run Cmd.bat

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ java -Xmx300m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

The error it gives me is:

Error: Could not find or load main class Launcher Press any key to continue . . .

Now I tried changing it to

@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause

This one gives me the error

Error: Could not find or load main class Gui Press any key to continue . . .

So either way I get an error. I looked through the files and couldn’t find a Gui.class or Gui.java file.
So any help with this would be great

Now Run.bat

Run.bat simply doesn’t start.

My current run.bat

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ start javaw -Xmx500m Launcher 10 0 highmem members 32 exit

When I change exit to pause to see the error it says press any key to continue. There is nothing else. I have tried changing it to things like

@echo off title Client cd bin "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\javaw.exe" -Xmx1024m client 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause

Read full topic
